comment: Took a long time to grade, but looking back I appreciated the readings we learned about in this class, that I otherwise would have never been introduced to.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I took him for summer, it was a bit hectic but its similar for every summer class. Its only now have I realized how awesome he was. We had to build a blog site and create a pecha kucha video which felt a lot but I now have a site of my own for documenting research and can talk infront of mass. As a international student he taught me soo much.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Amazing lectures

comment: I really liked this class and the professor. Attendance does matter in this class. He is a very kind person, however, he does take all semester to grade assignments. The assignments are also very time-consuming, especially the final project. If he sees you are working hard, he will be pretty lenient.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor is very unresponsive, and does not grade anything at all. He says he will give feedback or post weekly, and we're lucky to get a post every 3-4 weeks. Very frustrating semester trying to guess what he wants.

Took him for summer 2023. Great professor, has prior experience in teaching. Expect to read! as your essays will be argumentative and you will have to cite it all with scholarly sources. You schedule when you turn in your assignments. Be on top of it as it is all connected for your final couple of essays. Communicate ahead of time he's reasonable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: I took him as a summer semester class it was really difficult to keep up but he was really helpful and I think that taking him as a regular semester it will be much easier. His projects teaches how to do more things  more concrete and efficiently and I think that the new formats to do the projects will help me in the future.
rating_tags: Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: I took this class as a summer class, so it was challenging, but I imagine as a full-semester student, it would be much easier to flow with. The professor is awesome, but not good at responding to emails but will be understanding if you explain you attempted to before talking with him in person. Research heavy and time-consuming but lots of fun.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Clear grading criteria

comment: One of the best professors I've ever had, and he's a very cool person as well. For a literature class, he made reading each book enjoyable and the discussions we had in class were always fun and insightful.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Amazing lectures

comment: One of my top 3 favorite professors I have ever had. We read 4 books, but it didn't seem like too much reading. the dude is HILARIOUS! Great books, and great lecture. A little hard to reach outside of class, but very helpful when you talk in person. We also did a group project, which wasn't too bad. Definitely take Pete if you have the chance!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Hilarious

comment: Read 4 books throughout the semester, so you go through them pretty quickly. Almost every class is a discussion over what was read. You choose to either take a final/annotated bibliography or a midterm/research proposal. There's an article related to each book that is read. Weekly discussion posts most of the time, and a group presentation.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: A little strict on grading but overall cool and laidback. We read 4 books & spent a lot of class time discussing them, but not in a boring or tedious way! Literature/English aren't my favorite subject but this class kept me very engaged & interested. There's also a mandatory group project but you get to be creative with it. Take Dr. R if you can!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Weekly read-&-respond tasks: easy but time consuming. Only issue is that he NEVER answers emails, and won't give you any grades until the last week of the semester. Basically non existent except for class time. Not a tough grader, but don't expect any kind of feedback. No point showing up to class, we never did anything
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: So this guys is alright. he uses a program called slack which is EXTREMELY confusing at first. but he makes you read SOO many artlices and write summarys for all of them. you wanna know your grade? good fkn luck. he didn't grade shii till the LAST WEEK of the semester. so if u failed, you wouldn't know, and u'd have ZERO time to make it up. :))
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--So many papers

comment: This guy is one of my favs, really engaging and interesting class/conversations. Class was mostly optional as long as you did 3 really engaging classes over the semester, but most of use went to a lot of them just to engage. He uses Slack so was a little confusing and didn't grade much towards the end, but I think that was cuz Covid. Very nice guy.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--Caring

comment: All in all this class wasn't that hard. Manage your time wisely. I suggest starting the major assignments at least 2 weeks before. Slack was very helpful I think all professors should use it. If you're a person of color and you're exhausted about the struggles of being black I'd recommend a different professor because that was the main focus
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Passionate guy about the issues and very open to students differing perspective. Make sure to participate on the days you have him and you'll be fine. No Final however you have a semester long project to worth through. Would take again ��
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: He's awesome! He's pretty passionate about writing and it shows in his grading process as well--pretty lenient and just wants you to grow as a writer. The course is pretty interesting too and was amazing to have him as the prof for it.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Inspirational

comment: Professor Rorabaugh is a very cool dude! The class is pretty easy and doesn't have too much work. You have a weekly assignment which takes about an hour, and 3 major assignments. You also get to pick when your assignments are due which is cool. You also only have to come to 3 classes the whole semester. Great class and great guy!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I felt like he did not put any effort into this class. His directions were vague, he cancelled so much class, and he never posted on time. He didn't even grade my two presentations, my final, or my research paper that he made me write twice (said it was "bad" and I had to start over). That's 60% of my grade left blank. Very irritating semester.

Dr. Pete was an INCREDIBLE Professor. He was extremely passionate about the subject, and an incredibly lenient grader. I wanted to learn from him, and he made me want to work hard in his class. Hands down one of the best professors Ive had to date!
10/10 easy class. Pete is super funny and does a great job of making you think.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Hilarious

comment: Favorite teacher ever? His ENGL1102 class surrounded specific themes: race, class, identity. If you feel uncomfortable with these topics, pick another course. If you're fine, get ready to challenge your ideals. Yes, you learn about rhetoric and argument structure, but you ultimately learn more about people in general. Also, no printed books.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Lots of homework

comment: Overall a really cool guy, will spend the first 10 minutes of class talking abt movies if you get him going. A 100-300 word writing assignment every week plus 4 big projects, you choose your due dates. Takes FOREVER to get grades back but gives specific feedback and will let you revise. Assignments MUST relate back to overall topic (race for mine).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Hilarious--So many papers

comment: Pete is a good guy, funny and down to earth but his class was a bit hard. I took his hybrid class and I had a hard time keeping up with endless writing assignments. If you wanna pass his class you've gotta work for it and be a generally good writer. Pete is very accessible if you have questions, but his grade/feedback turnaround takes a LONG time.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He's awesome. He's understanding about giving students time to complete assignments, and understands things when you just talk to him. He's hilarious, and can hold a good conversation about the class subject. The writing assignments really are not that hard- just do them. He's cool. Would take again.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Hilarious

comment: He is a nice and funny guy who allows you to pick the topics that you want to talk about, but the assignments are too much (2000 word essay? 4 posts each being 800 words? REALLY) . It makes it seem you are not in an English 1102 class but a English 3250 class. If you want a simple gen-ed class, this class isnt for you. The stress is not worth it.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He is a funny teacher and allows for us to choose topics, but the amount of work that we had in this class was ridiculous compared to other ENG 1102 classes. For example, there was a blog cycle assignment where we had to write 4 posts each being 800 words. Other people in different ENG 1102 classes did not have this much work. Wouldn't recommend.
rating_tags: SO MANY PAPERS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: A lot of writing assignments, but it was very easy. He lets you choose what you want to write about instead of forcing a boring topic. Easy A if you do the assigned work with some effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Don't take him. For a general ed class, he makes it feel like an upper level English class. The amount of work that we have like a 2000 word rhetorical analysis, 4 blog posts each 800 words, collaborative bibliography, and a multimedia presentation 5-7 minutes. I had to drop this class because of the amount of stress it caused me.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Peter Rorabaugh is the best professor you can get in Kennesaw's English department. You get to choose when to do your assignments and how to do them. There are many in class discussions about big topics that the students get to choose themselves. The guy is hilarious! He also loves to talk to students about their favorite movies and shows.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: He is reasonable when it comes to submitting assignments. He's always willing to help. You get to schedule when your major assignments are due. He is very disorganized. When he says he's going to post something, he never does. Don't count on him giving feedback before grades have to be turned in. And he never finishes things when he says he will.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Hands down the best teacher I've ever had. In discussions, he will listen to you and he is very fair. Fair not only in class, but his general view on things. He'll help you become a better writer and student. Take him! (especially if you're an IT major)
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Inspirational

comment: I took Pete for my minor, and I haven't regretted it once. There are times where he can be disorganized, but for the most part, he's amazing, funny, and respects you and your questions. You do a lot of writing, but it's an English class, so it's normal. If you have a chance, take Pete's class!!! He's one of the best professors here!
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I took Mr. Rorabaugh's class as a free elective and wished it was longer or more in depth. A course schedule is not given out at the start of the semester and it instead class goes week by week and can sometimes be a bit hard to stay caught up, but It is a good challenge and not impossible. Class and topics discussed in class make it interesting.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I took his English 1102 hybrid class. By far my favorite English class ever taken. He lets you be individual. You choose what you want to write about. He encourages new ways of thinking. Class is not very hard, but you have to do your work for a good grade. Also he is funny.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Hilarious

comment: A very smart man, engages the classroom and all students. Listens thoughtfully to questions and gives an equally thoughtful response. Very keen on helping his students. His teaching always leaves you with something new to think about and ponder, he betters you as a student and encourages you to expand ideas
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Inspirational

comment: Helpful
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Get ready to read

comment: I have a lot of respect for this man.
rating_tags: Respected--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rorabaugh is quite amazing. You are required to buy a domain (I would have preferred to use WordPress only) but it is worth it in the end. All assignments are made up of the blog posts and Annotated Biblio. It's a very easy going class and I would recommend showing up because it is worth it.
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Hilarious

comment: I've taken four classes with this man and he's probably my favorite professor so far. He's open to ideas and suggestions from students and he's fairly lenient with due dates. He's a fair grader. I love his classes because I love his lectures. You have to participate in open discussions with both him and classmates. You can't pass without it.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I learned nothing useful in this class. Has weird assignment that will not help you write for college at all. Seems to care more about his ego and his personal interests than teaching you how to write.

Took Hybrid class.  Probably my favorite professor. Coolest guy, super nice, super understanding, made class very interesting.  We used Google+, Google Docs, Twitter, Tumblr, Storify and other platforms with made the class interesting.. sometimes assignment instructions were a bit incoherent, but he was helpful if anyone had questions.

Great teacher, absolutely great. Made literature one of the most enjoyable classes in my college career. Not only was our reading material interesting(No Country for Old Men, Beloved, etc) but he made the themes relate-able. It wasn't just a bunch old stories and useless knowledge. It a lit class that was actually interesting and thought provoking.

He's an excellent teacher and nice guy in general. Doesn't like traditional class styles and incorporated a lot of online activities (Twitter, Wiki pages) and the grade is based on 3 major assignments (Group project, Wiki page and only 1 paper for an english course!), a few quizzes, and participation.
